bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. RANGEL:H.R. 6265.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8[Page H5630]

item.title: A bill to extend the temporary duty suspensions on certain cotton shirting fabrics, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: Citrus, Wool, and Cotton Trust Fund Act of 2012

latestAction.text: By Senator Baucus from Committee on Finance filed written report. Report No. 112-227.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to: (1) modify the article description of certain cotton shirting fabrics, and (2) extend the temporary duty suspensions on such fabrics.

Amends the Tax Relief and Health Care Act of 2006 to extend through December 31, 2015, the requirement that the Secretary of the Treasury transfer from the Treasury to the Pima Cotton Trust Fund amounts equal to the duties received in the Treasury from certain imported woven fabrics of cotton since January 1, 2004 (currently, January 1, 1994).

Repeals the limitation that pima cotton be grown in the United States from the formula for determination of annual payments to a nationally recognized association established for the promotion of pima cotton as well as to the yarn spinners of pima cotton. Limits the latter payments to yarn spinners of pima cotton that produce ring spun cotton yarns in the United States.

Requires annual affidavits from shirting manufacturers and from yarn spinners.

bill.title: To renew and modify the temporary duty suspensions on certain cotton shirting fabrics.

item.title: To renew and modify the temporary duty suspensions on certain cotton shirting fabrics.
To renew and modify the temporary duty suspensions on certain cotton shirting fabrics.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
